meanings.definition: Not conforming to the principles or practices of a church.
meanings.sent1: Her unchurchly behavior during the service raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent2: The unchurchly music blared from the speakers, disrupting the solemn atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The cat's unchurchly habit of napping on the altar amused the parishioners.
meanings.sent4: His unchurchly attire, complete with neon sneakers, stood out among the traditional congregation.
meanings.sent5: The unchurchly graffiti on the church walls was a shocking sight for the parishioners.

meanings.definition: Not appropriate for or characteristic of a church.
meanings.sent1: The unchurchly language used by the comedian offended some members of the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The bright pink walls of the cafe gave it an unchurchly appearance.
meanings.sent3: The unchurchly dance moves of the mascot entertained the children at the church fair.
meanings.sent4: The unchurchly smell of fried food wafted from the food truck parked outside the church.
meanings.sent5: The unchurchly decorations at the event included disco balls and neon lights.
